newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Spector says sees better performance 1997.
newsitem.headline: Spector says sees better performance 1997.

text.p: Belgian photo processing group Spector, which suffered a steep fall in 1996 profit, said on Thursday it expected to put in a better performance in 1997.

"The strengthened management of the group, cost controls, better raw material prices, the application of direct marketing techniques...and the growing success of mail order photograph sales should produce better results in 1997," the firm said in a statement accompanying its annual results.
Spector said group net earnings fell 54 percent to 108 million Belgian francs in 1996 due to a provision of 223 million francs linked to its Interdiscount France unit.
